lines.text: It's hard to explain, Itch. This place is supposed to have everything but it doesn't. It's too... it's too...
[singing]

it's too heavenly here/It's too graceful and paradise-like/Much too narrow and much too nice like/Endlessly sunny and clear/It's too heavenly here/It's too blissfull to bear/Calm and quiet and much too mellow/
[Knocks over a tray of halos which all go around Itchy]
/All my brain cells have turned to jello/Every day feels like a year/
[Someone pushes the halos off Itchy and drops both of them]
It's too heavenly here.
[Grabs a harp on the way down]
I need some action/I need some juice/
[Fires Itchy with the harp like a bow and arrow]

A crazy kind of feeling of playing fast and loose/Some razzle dazzle and a little stress and strife/I gotta get some life in my life/But it's too heavenly here/There's no way you can be a sinner/Roll the dice/Everyone's a winner/It's so legit and sincere/It's too heavenly here/What good's a hustler/Without scam/I'm wasted talent/That's all that I am/This operator/Is at the wrong adress/Cause there's nothing to finagle/And no one to fineeeeeeeese

[while bathing them]
It's so heavenly here/Pure and perfect/Sublime and shining/Every cloud has a silver lining/Everyone's full of good cheer/It's so heavenly here.

[singing again]
They're all so saintly, I just can't relate/There's gotta be an exit/Through that pearly gate/
[Throws his halo just missing Itchy]
Behold the canine who's been cut down in his prime/
[the halo comes back over his head]

I may have done the crime/ But I can't do the time/Cause it's too heavenly here/All Hallelujas and Hosannas/It can drive anyone bananas/I'm going out of my head/This joint is deader than dead/I'll give you eight to three/It's too heavenly...
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
To heaaaaaveeeeenly heeeeeeeere.

[singing]
Everybody's a winner. It's so legit and sincere. It's too heavenly here.
He's only 8 years old!
That's 56 in dog years.
Fine! Don't listen to me. Listen to your guardian angel.
David, Cannery Square sounds like a great plan to me.
[the Labrador gives Sasha a first-place ribbon and a bone for winning the talent contest]
You advertised a meal for the winner!
If it's a meal ya want honey, I'm off at ten.
Honey, I'd rather eat out of the garbage.

[almost to himself]
That's what I had in mind.
Why don't you ask him yourself?
Now that would be a miracle.
One miracle coming up.
[disappears by taking off the collar and reappears in front of Sasha and kisses her, his miracle goes into her]
Ugh! Of all the arrogant, presumptuous, egotistical mutts I've ever met!
Ahh! Now you talk.
[Sasha puts her paw over her mouth]
You must be an angel.
By the way, Carface, what did you trade Red for your collar?
He wanted the bottom of my shoes, or something. Hehehe. I don't even wear shoes. Ah, stupid cat.

[from the hole which he went back to Hell through]
Stupid dog! It was your soul!
[Demons rise up from the hole and pull Carface into the hole as the others look down]
Let me go! Red! This is not good! Red, no! Not the flames!
What do you know? And I thought all dogs go to Heaven.

[Just arrived in heaven]
I can't believe it! I...
[pauses]
I'm not itchy.
That's funny. You look like him.

[laughing]
No, I mean for the first time in my life, I don't have to scratch!
Of course not, Itch. This is heaven. Fleas go to the other place.

[after David reconciles with his dad and stepmom]
I've been worried sick about you.
You were worried about me?

[smiles]
Of course. Having this baby doesn't mean I don't love you.

[hugs her]
I know that now... mom.
Honey, we're a family.
That's right - just a bigger one.

[as they walk in the house]
Dad? Mom? Speaking of bigger families, do you think we have room for a pet or two?
Hi, I'm Charlie. And, you are?
Not remotely interested.
I'm so hungry, I could eat a shoe.
Is there a Mr. Sasha?
No. And I'm not taking applications.
We're talking the mean streets of Frisco here, Ace, not Mount Happy-Go-Lucky.

[singing]
It feels so good to be bad! So delicious to be a despicable cad. It's just so thrilling and so fulfilling to give somebody the worst time they've ever had!
[first lines]

[on the payphone]
Boss, uh...
Something happened. What's wrong?
You'll have the item today, just like we agreed. It's as good as in your hands. Nothing can go wrong!
You contemptible canine!
Don't call me canine!
[Red grumbles]
Do you know the meaning of patience?

[the phone receiver burns in Carface's hand]
Silence! As long as dogs are involved, ANYTHING CAN GO WRONG!

[hangs up]
I'll take that as a no. Sheesh, what a hothead!
[the sound of change is heard]

[checks]
Ah, keep the quarter.
[Carface puts his halo on and leaves as the receiver burns and smokes up without notice]

[after the root beer falls through his mouth]
What?

[sees that his and Charlie's reflections are not there]
Charlie, look! We ain't - oh! We're ghosts!
Annabelle! OF ALL THE ROTTEN TRICKS!

[after arriving to Earth from Heaven]
Hey-lo! Double chili cheeseburger with onions and pickles!
So, is there a Mr. Sasha?
Nope and I'm not taking applications.
Okay. Okay but, if you were; what uh... what qualities would you be looking for?
Oh, I don't know.
Ah, of course you do.
Hmmm. Well... loyalty, strength, breeding...
I'd be good at that.
...humility... compassion
[Charlie accidently hits his head]
and of course, style.
You dogs have enjoyed a state of grace for far too long, wouldn't you agree Carface?
Er, yeah, whatever you say Boss.
All these cells, filled with dogs... can you see it?
Oh yeah, er sure.
And me playing Gabriel's Horn! Can you hear it?
Oh sure, just put your lips together and blow?
And then, the grand finale!
That's er, that's not coming in so clear actual.
Oh it will, and all thanks to Charlie Barkin!
[laughs evilly]
Make sure he doesn't disappoint me!
You got it Boss!

[singing]
It's so so stirring, I feel like purring!
It's deeply pleasing to be the reason...
So many will be so sad!
Three cheers for treachery! It feel so good to be bad!
Come on Red, you can trust me.
This isn't about trust, a deal with me is binding.

[after revealing true form to Charlie and Itchy]
Guess the cat's out of the bag. Aye?
